newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rights court warns Austria against expulsion.
newsitem.headline: Rights court warns Austria against expulsion.

text.p: The European Court of Human Rights urged Austria on Tuesday not to send home a convicted Somali robber saying he may face torture in his country as a former political dissident.
The court said deporting Sharif Hussein Ahmed home would breach the European Human Rights Convention which bans torture.
Ahmed arrived in Austria in 1990. His refugee status was withdrawn in 1994 after he was sentenced to 30 months in jail for attempted robbery.

Ahmed, who is still in Austria, appealed against an expulsion order, arguing that he could face torture or execution upon returning to Somalia. The expulsion order was alternatively upheld and stayed by various Austrian authorities.
